page.title: 17TRAVELLING IN HORNSEA
page.content:
We sent a questionnaire out to all the families of the children in the 5th year of Hornsea Primary School asking about their methods of travel. We found 82% of families sampled owned motor cars. Of those who owned cars 73% used them to travel to work. The majority worked in Hull. 60% used their cars to go shopping but this was usually to shop locally in Hornsea. Only 23% of families surveyed used the public bus service. We asked the families if they thought Hornsea had a good bus service. Of all the replies received 82% thought Hornsea had a poor bus service. Suggested ways in which it could be improved were:-
More buses 50% Faster buses 10% Mini-buses 17% Cheaper fares 15% Local service 8% PAUL TEMPLEMAN 5.G.
